hints.label: unlabeled-proof-25
hints.content:
2182: :::{prf:proof}
2183: 
2184: **Step 1: Factorization of the QSD.**
2185: 
2186: For separable $H_{\text{eff}}$, the QSD factorizes as:
2187: 
2188: $$
2189: \rho_{\text{QSD}}(x, v; \theta) = \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x; V, N) \cdot \rho_{\text{kinetic}}(v; \beta)
2190: $$
2191: 
2192: where:
2193: 
2194: $$
2195: \begin{align}
2196: \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x; V, N) &= \frac{\sqrt{\det g(x)} e^{-\beta U(x)}}{Z_{\text{spatial}}(V, N, \beta)} \\
2197: \rho_{\text{kinetic}}(v; \beta) &= \frac{e^{-\beta v^T M v / 2}}{Z_{\text{kinetic}}(\beta)}
2198: \end{align}
2199: $$
2200: 
2201: **Step 2: Compute expectations.**
2202: 
2203: For $\theta^i$ controlling spatial properties ($\beta_i = 0$):
2204: 
2205: $$
2206: s_i = g^{ab}(x) H_{ab,i}(x) \quad \text{(depends only on } x \text{)}
2207: $$
2208: 
2209: For $\theta^j = \beta$:
2210: 
2211: $$
2212: k_j = H_{\text{eff}}(x, v) = U(x) + \frac{1}{2}v^T M v
2213: $$
2214: 
2215: **Step 3: Factorize the covariance.**
2216: 
2217: $$
2218: \begin{align}
2219: \text{Cov}(s_i, k_j) &= \mathbb{E}[s_i k_j] - \mathbb{E}[s_i]\mathbb{E}[k_j] \\
2220: &= \mathbb{E}[s_i(x) \cdot (U(x) + \tfrac{1}{2}v^T M v)] - \mathbb{E}[s_i(x)] \mathbb{E}[U(x) + \tfrac{1}{2}v^T M v]
2221: \end{align}
2222: $$
2223: 
2224: Using the factorized measure $\rho = \rho_{\text{spatial}} \cdot \rho_{\text{kinetic}}$:
2225: 
2226: $$
2227: \begin{align}
2228: \mathbb{E}[s_i \cdot U] &= \int s_i(x) U(x) \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) dx \\
2229: \mathbb{E}[s_i \cdot v^T M v] &= \int s_i(x) \rho_{\text{spatial}}(x) dx \cdot \int \tfrac{1}{2}v^T M v \, \rho_{\text{kinetic}}(v) dv \\
2230: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i] \cdot \mathbb{E}_{\text{kinetic}}[v^T M v]
2231: \end{align}
2232: $$
2233: 
2234: **Step 4: Simplify.**
2235: 
2236: $$
2237: \begin{align}
2238: \text{Cov}(s_i, k_j) &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i U] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i] \mathbb{E}_{\text{kinetic}}[v^T M v] \\
2239: &\quad - \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i] \left(\mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[U] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{kinetic}}[v^T M v]\right) \\
2240: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i U] - \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[s_i] \mathbb{E}_{\text{spatial}}[U] \\
2241: &= \text{Cov}_{\text{spatial}}(s_i, U)
2242: \end{align}
2243: $$
2244: 
2245: **Step 5: Apply orthogonality for distinct parameter types.**
2246: 
2247: When $\theta^i$ controls geometry (via $g_{ab}$) and $\theta^j = \beta$ controls only temperature:
2248: - $s_i$ depends on spatial derivatives of $U$ through $g^{ab} \partial^2 U / \partial x^a \partial x^b$
2249: - For generic potentials $U$, spatial Hessian derivatives are uncorrelated with $U$ itself under the weighted measure
2250: 
2251: More precisely, for the **canonical parametrization** where $\theta^i = V$ (volume):
2252: 
2253: $$
2254: s_i = g^{ab} \frac{\partial^2 U}{\partial x^a \partial x^b} \cdot \frac{\partial}{\partial V}
2255: $$

hints.label: unlabeled-remark-103
hints.title: Practical Implications
hints.content:
2261: :class: tip
2262: 
2263: The vanishing cross-covariance means the Fisher information metric is **block-diagonal**:
2264: 
2265: $$
2266: g_{\text{Fisher}} = \begin{pmatrix}
2267: g_{\text{Fisher}}^{\beta\beta} & 0 & 0 \\
2268: 0 & g_{\text{Fisher}}^{VV} & g_{\text{Fisher}}^{VN} \\
2269: 0 & g_{\text{Fisher}}^{NV} & g_{\text{Fisher}}^{NN}
2270: \end{pmatrix}
2271: $$
2272: 
2273: with:
2274: - $g^{\beta\beta} = \text{Var}(H_{\text{eff}}) = T^2 C_V$ (pure kinetic)
2275: - $g^{VV}, g^{VN}, g^{NN}$ (pure spatial)
